function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of interest from employers and building owners","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reluctance to share personal data is a significant challenge for achieving the design and operation of buildings that support and promote occupant health.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in defining quantitative metrics for occupant health in buildings","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ambiguity in the type of data that should be collected","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty of linking building-related data to occupant health","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of comprehensive measurement of economic value of health in buildings","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglect of healthy building performance during extreme events","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disparities in health conditions based on income and race","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of optimal layouts for physical distancing","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for occupant health in building design","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited emphasis on designing, constructing, and operating buildings with occupant health and well-being as an objective","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Resistance to the healthy building movement","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Scarcity of real-world cases and lack of confidence in healthy building initiatives","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased focus on occupant health in building design and operation due to recent pandemic.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Data-related challenges for achieving design and operation of healthy buildings.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of pandemic on building professionals’ perspective regarding buildings’ impact on occupant health.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of viruses in indoor environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surface-touch contamination as a mode of virus transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Generalizing results from a sample dominated by engineers, architects, and facility managers","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pandemic bias effect on questionnaire responses","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential lag in academic publications compared to current trends","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased focus on physical and mental well-being in building occupant health","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on questionnaires as the primary method for studying and measuring occupant health may lead to incomplete or biased data.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Major focus on office buildings in research studies and practice-based efforts may neglect other types of buildings that also impact occupant health.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding about the effect of building attributes on occupant health","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Absence of an effective collaboration framework between different stakeholders of a building","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Privacy concerns, reluctance to share data, and difficulty in defining quantitative metrics","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased focus on occupant health in building design, construction, and operation due to the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Greater attention to ventilation systems to maintain high indoor air quality and limit infection in indoor spaces.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on mental health in building occupant studies","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglect of interdisciplinary collaboration in promoting occupant health","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider the trade-off and synergies between energy efficiency, sustainability, and occupant health","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"No disclosure of competing financial interests or personal relationships","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of * for experimental/laboratory studies without specifying the building type","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of clear and commonly accepted definition of ’healthy building’","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited systematic process to incorporate who’s definitions of health in buildings","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility in building design to adapt to changes without compromising occupant well-being","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Emerging environmental concerns such as climate change and pollution may lead to an increased risk of contagious diseases in buildings.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global epidemics of stress and longer working hours may impact occupant mental and social well-being in buildings.","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor indoor air quality due to contaminants from outdoor and indoor sources","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Elevated negative emotions, aggressive behaviors, and mental fatigue due to indoor air contaminants","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependency between ventilation rates and respiratory symptoms in single-family houses and sick building syndromes in offices","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased risk of sbs symptoms due to high air temperature exceeding 22°c","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of exposure to natural light affecting mood, sleep quality, and vitamin d levels","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate access to natural views contributing to job stress in office workers","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Noise pollution in buildings from various sources impacting occupant well-being and health","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disease outbreaks due to poor water quality and distribution in buildings","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of physical activity opportunities in buildings leading to occupant health issues","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor building design contributing to the spread of contagious diseases through close proximity and shared facilities.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and air quality leading to the accumulation of airborne contaminants and pathogens.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
